thread.title: Lorain teen singer\/songwriter Mason Mitchell to release first single 'i love you i'm sorry' on New Year's Day
thread.title_full: Lorain teen singer\/songwriter Mason Mitchell to release first single 'i love you i'm sorry' on New Year's Day

author: Editorial staff
title: Lorain teen singer\/songwriter Mason Mitchell to release first single 'i love you i'm sorry' on New Year's Day
text:
Things To Do Music and Concerts Music and Concerts | Lorain teen singer/songwriter Mason Mitchell to release first single ‘i love you i’m sorry’ on New Year’s Day Teen artist turns pain into triumph through new single Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to share on X (Opens in new window) Lorain teen artist Mason Mitchell will release his first single “i love you i’m sorry” on New Year’s Day. (Submitted) By Editorial staff | news@morningjournal.com PUBLISHED: December 26, 2024 at 5:30 PM EST Lorain teen artist Mason Mitchell is set to release his first single, according to a news release.
Mason, a student of Jaclyn Bradley at RockTown Music Academy in downtown Lorain, will release “i love you i’m sorry” on New Year’s Day, the release said.
The15-year-old and has been singing as long as he remembers, according to the release.
Mason also has been preforming on stage for years with MAD* Factory Theater Co and Lorain Palace Youth Theatre.
“Recently I’ve realized that I find acting to be work, even when it’s for fun,” he said in the release. “But, singing is always the thing I turn back to.”
In 2021, Mason had to go through a procedure that is commonly known, but isn’t understood, according to the release.
“When I was 11 years old, I had to have a complete spinal fusion due to scoliosis,” he said.
Mason went on to explain that many people do not understand how emotionally trying a surgery of that kind can be, the release said.
He stated that many times he would cry, not knowing if things as simple as putting on a pair of shoes would be simple again.
Since then, Mason said he always would include something into his music: vulnerability, the release said.
“When you are making music that you want people to listen to, and feel a connection to, you have to be vulnerable,” Mason said. “People have to feel what you felt in the moment.”
He said he strives to help people with his music.
Mason adds he wants people to feel like no matter what they are going through, whether it is a breakup or something larger, that they can turn to his music and be allowed to just feel.
Mason’s song “i love you i’m sorry” will be available on all streaming platforms Jan. 1 as the ball drops and begins a new year, according to the release.
Pre-saving for “i love you i’m sorry,” which is the action of saving a song to a person’s library before it is released, starts Dec. 27 through links on Mason’s social media @masonmitchellmusic.
